channel.title: A Serious Suggestion
channel.description:
This is a suggestion that would save so many people so much time and is very simple.
On the form for creating a new thread in certain sections like RSPS downloads, snipplets, tutorials and any other sections that would/could hold server specific topics should have an extra box in which the server base MUST be entered/selected to post the thread.
The only negative side to this is that there might be a couple mad noobs because they don't know the base of their leeched server but for every one asking or offering help it would be a huge time saver in that before help is given, there won't be 12 posts asking what base it is or of random code for the incorrect base.
Another plus side is that people that don't follow this can get warnings and banned! How fun!
Comment whether you agree or not. (srry for any spelling mistakes I might have, I wrote this on an iPod)

item.title: A Serious Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

The Reaper X:

It could be possible to change the message icon. It’s an optional anyways and not everyone relies on them.

Even that would be better or like a message reminding people to do so.

Read full topic

item.title: A Serious Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

If you’ve actually written a tutorial properly, the server that the tutorial reader uses should be regardless.

item.title: A Serious Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Yeah but realistically there is only 2 or 3 server bases is it worth the modification? Also why can’t the user just look at the code and see if it fits into his or her server the user should know what they are working with.

Read full topic

item.title: A Serious Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

Who cares if they don’t mention it, 4/10 don’t mention there a virus either, and you don’t see people like “MAKE CLICK BOXES SO WE KNOW IF YOUR SERVERS A VIRUS OR NOT”.

Read full topic

item.title: A Serious Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

krackkid:

What about people and there 517/474/317/518/etc… That would take to much work, and it doesn’t even matter that much.

I think your think of this in too big a manner. It should not be a global requirement as I said but only in the needed sections because like 7 out of 10 threads don’t mention what base they have and it causes a bunch of problems and wasted time. If we are able to, why would/should we hold back and not increase productivicty?

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: A Serious Suggestion
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:2, topic:367037”]What happens if some one like umm makes a 317 with HD models and stuff? Would there be a box for 317HD?

But no seriously there is no points, they would just check a random one and go on with there lives.

EDIT//(Holy I didn’t curse in this guys thread yet FUCK)[/quote]

Simple fix, if you can’t help keep it organized, you can goto jail. Like the famous quote from “The Crucible”. “You are either with the court, or an enemy of it. There is no middle ground.”

for HD Models, that’s not server specific, therefor wouldn’t require this suggestion on the model section.

Read full topic
